body_html:
There are no binary packages for Windows (yet), so as Andrew says you'll have to build it yourself. It's currently possible to build a TensorFlow PIP package on Windows using Bazel or (if you want GPU support) CMake.

There's an example script for using Bazel on Windows here and instructions for using CMake on Windows here.
body_text:
There are no binary packages for Windows (yet), so as Andrew says you'll have to build it yourself. It's currently possible to build a TensorFlow PIP package on Windows using Bazel or (if you want GPU support) CMake.
There's an example script for using Bazel on Windows here and instructions for using CMake on Windows here.
body:
There are no binary packages for Windows (yet), so as Andrew says you'll have to build it yourself. It's currently possible to build a TensorFlow PIP package on Windows using Bazel or (if you want GPU support) CMake.

There's an example script for using Bazel on Windows [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/816ecb7a342c25c19daa8b19627346e1fb38e56f/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/cpu/pip/build_tf_windows.sh) and instructions for using CMake on Windows [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/816ecb7a342c25c19daa8b19627346e1fb38e56f/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/README.md).
